meanings.definition: An ancestor in the direct line.
meanings.sent1: My progenitor, my great-grandfather, came to this country many years ago.
meanings.sent2: The progenitor of our family tree can be traced back to the 18th century.
meanings.sent3: I like to imagine my progenitor as a wise old owl guiding our family through history.
meanings.sent4: The roots of our family, like those of a mighty oak, can be traced back to our progenitor.
meanings.sent5: The image of my progenitor, a strong and resilient figure, inspires me to carry on our family legacy.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that originates something.
meanings.sent1: The inventor of the first computer was a true progenitor of modern technology.
meanings.sent2: Steve Jobs is considered a progenitor of the smartphone revolution.
meanings.sent3: The chef, a progenitor of delicious recipes, always surprises us with new flavors.
meanings.sent4: Her groundbreaking research made her a progenitor in the field of medicine.
meanings.sent5: The artist's unique style became the progenitor of a new art movement.
